--- title: bocos keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "This module contains the different boundary conditions available to work with PDEs" ---

class Boco[source]

Boco(name=None)

Base class to work with bocos

class PeriodicBocoDataset[source]

PeriodicBocoDataset(inputs1, inputs2) :: Dataset

Receives two dicts of arrays and returns every possible combination of the elements in each dict by pairs

class PeriodicBoco[source]

PeriodicBoco(name, inputs1, inputs2) :: Boco

Periodic boundary condition: The outputs of both inputs will be enforced to be equal.

Example

pde = PDE(inputs=['a', 'b'], outputs=['c'])

a1, a2 = np.array([0]), np.array([1])
b = np.array([1, 2, 3])

boco = PeriodicBoco('boco1', {'a': a1, 'b': b}, {'a': a2, 'b': b})
pde.addBoco(boco)

pde.bocoSummary()

boco1 summary:
Type: periodic
Input 1:  {'a': array([0]), 'b': array([1, 2, 3])}
Input 2:  {'a': array([1]), 'b': array([1, 2, 3])}

class DirichletBocoDataset[source]

DirichletBocoDataset(inputs, outputs) :: Dataset

Receives a dict of inputs and outputs and returns every possible combination of the elements in inputs that must match the outputs

class DirichletBoco[source]

DirichletBoco(name, inputs, outputs) :: Boco

Dirichlet boundary condition: Fixed outputs.

Example

pde = PDE(inputs=['a', 'b'], outputs=['c'])

a = np.array([0])
b = np.array([1, 2, 3])
c = np.array([-1, -2, -3])

boco = DirichletBoco('dirichlet1', {'a': a, 'b': b}, {'c': c})
pde.addBoco(boco)
    
pde.bocoSummary()

dirichlet1 summary:
Type: dirichlet
Inputs:  {'a': array([0]), 'b': array([1, 2, 3])}
Outputs:  {'c': array([-1, -2, -3])}

The different outputs must have a length equal to the product of the lengths of all the inputs.

a = np.array([0, 1])             # 2
b = np.array([1, 2, 3])          # 3
c = np.array([-1, -2, -3, 1, 2]) # 5, one output missing (2*3 = 6)

try:
    boco = DirichletBoco('name', {'a': a, 'b': b}, {'c': c})
except Exception as e:
    assert str(e) == "length of c incorrect", "assertion failed"

class NeumannBocoDataset[source]

NeumannBocoDataset(inputs) :: Dataset

Receives a dict of inputs and eturns every possible combination of the elements

class NeumannBoco[source]

NeumannBoco(name, inputs, grads) :: Boco

Neumann boundary condition: Enforces the value of certain grads to be 0

Example

pde = PDE(inputs=['a', 'b'], outputs=['c'])

a = np.array([0])
b = np.array([1, 2, 3])

boco = NeumannBoco('neumann', {'a': a, 'b': b}, grads={'c': 'a'}) # dc/da will be enforced to be 0
pde.addBoco(boco)
    
pde.bocoSummary()

neumann summary:
Type: neumann
Inputs:  {'a': array([0]), 'b': array([1, 2, 3])}
Grads:  {'c': 'a'}
